definition: lit. heart like a frisky monkey, mind like a cantering horse (idiom); fig. capricious (derog.)/to have ants in one's pants/hyperactive/adventurous and uncontrollable
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Cancers often choose one kind of taste in chocolate and rarely then change their minds.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座往往选择一种口味的巧克力就很少再心猿意马。

sentences.english: Never think of learning another subject while studying one thing.
sentences.chinese: 在学习一样东西的时候，切不可心猿意马。

sentences.english: After the XiaShi always bring, also do not go to see the fix two.
sentences.chinese: 之后夏实总是过的心猿意马，也不去看修二。

sentences.english: I lay awake thinking and mind jumping around.
sentences.chinese: 我睡不着，只顾躺着寻思，心猿意马。

definition: to indulge in fantasy (idiom); to let one's imagination run wild
lit. itchy heart/to be itching to do sth (idiom)
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
